unnormalised: New Delhi: The RBI has mandated stricter KYC norms for all bank accounts following a recent surge in fraudulent activities. Sources suggest the increasing number of scams prompted the regulatory body to take immediate action. Customers holding accounts opened before 01/01/2023 are particularly urged to re-submit their KYC details.
normalised: New Delhi: The R-B-I has mandated stricter K-Y-C norms for all bank accounts following a recent surge in fraudulent activities. Sources suggest the increasing number of scams prompted the regulatory body to take immediate action. Customers holding accounts opened before first january two thousand and twenty three are particularly urged to re-submit their K-Y-C details.

unnormalised: Specifically, banks are now required to verify PAN card numbers (e.g., ABCDE1234F) and Aadhaar numbers (e.g., 2345-6789-0123) linked to existing accounts. Furthermore, individuals with multiple accounts, especially those with dormant accounts lacking recent activity, are under greater scrutiny. The regulator emphasizes the need for customers to provide their latest information including their customer ID (CIF No.) to ensure a seamless verification process.
normalised: Specifically, banks are now required to verify P-A-N card numbers (e.g., A-B-C-D-E-one-two-three-four-F) and Aadhaar numbers (e.g., two-three-four-five hyphen six-seven-eight-nine hyphen zero-one-two-three) linked to existing accounts. Furthermore, individuals with multiple accounts, especially those with dormant accounts lacking recent activity, are under greater scrutiny. The regulator emphasizes the need for customers to provide their latest information including their customer I-D (C-I-F number) to ensure a seamless verification process.

unnormalised: Experts believe this move will help curb money laundering and other illicit financial activities. SBI has already begun sending out reminders to customers via SMS and email. Failure to comply with the revised KYC norms by 31/07/2024 could result in account restrictions.
